events.description: Serving as an effective, one-day event organized for first-following years. The event will feature a project showcase from various domains such as IoT, Robotics, AI/ML, and Development. The primary focus will be on presenting the vision of the DSC Chapter under the Technology Club of NIT Srinagar. Additionally, there will be an ice-break sessions, engaging activities, prize distribution, refreshments, and other necessary arrangements.

A week-long AIML Boot Camp designed to introduce participants to the fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, and to help them build a strong foundation in these cutting-edge technologies. The camp will feature daily sessions of one to one and a half hours — held in the evenings on weekdays and in the mornings on weekends. A certificate of completion will be awarded to all participants on the final day.
The day-long college event - Orientation for innovation sessions to help new students familiarize themselves with the campus, facilities, and clubs.

Movie screenings every Friday and Saturday from 8:30 PM to 10:30 PM. A facilitated relaxed environment for students and faculty for movie screenings and entertainment. The movie club will conduct an information program for first-year students to introduce the club's activities, objectives, and opportunities for participation in movie and dance events throughout the academic year.
Open students with film and musical events, club and public speech competition.

A hands-on Saurcam Workshop introducing the current trends and its features, apps, and programming. Apart from the feature showcasing, we will provide basic insights on its various functionality including audio coding techniques, and entertainment, safety, cultural heritage, and advancement.

It will be an offline, one-day event organized for the incoming batch. The event will feature a project showcase from various domains such as IoT, Robotics, AI/ML, and Development. The primary focus will be on presenting the vision of the RSC Chapter under the Technology Club of NIT Srinagar. Additionally, there will be on-the-spot quizzes, engaging activities, prize distribution, refreshments, and other necessary arrangements.

A week-long AI/ML Boot Camp designed to introduce participants to the fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, and to help them build a strong foundation in these cutting-edge technologies. The camp will feature daily sessions of one to one-and-a-half hours — held in the evenings on weekdays and in the mornings on weekends. A certificate of completion will be awarded to all participants on the final day.
Two day intra college event, Orientation (An introductory session to help new students familiarize themselves with the campus, facilities, and culture.)

A hands-on Silambam Workshop introducing the ancient martial art’s footwork, spins, and staff techniques for fitness, focus, and self-discipline. These two days blends demonstrations and guided practice, emphasizing safety, cultural heritage, and foundational skills.
